Map bioregion clusters and generate interpolated spatial assignments

Source: R/map_bioreg.R
map_bioreg.Rd

Performs environmental clustering (k-means, PAM, hierarchical, GMM), aligns cluster labels to k-means reference, plots comparative cluster maps, and interpolates assignments over a raster grid using nearest-neighbor and/or thin-plate spline methods.

Usage

map_bioreg(
  data,
  scale_cols,
  clus_method = "all",
  plot = TRUE,
  interp = "both",
  x_col = "x",
  y_col = "y",
  resolution = 0.5
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame containing coordinate columns and values for clustering.

scale_cols

Character vector of column names in data to scale before clustering.

clus_method

Character; one or more clustering methods: "kmeans", "pam", "hclust", "gmm", or "all". Default = "all".

plot

Logical; if TRUE, displays side-by-side cluster maps. Default = TRUE.

interp

Character; interpolation method(s): "NN" (nearest neighbor), "Tps" (thin-plate spline), or "both". Default = "both".

x_col

Name of the longitude column in data. Default = "x".

y_col

Name of the latitude column in data. Default = "y".

Value

A list with elements:

data

Original data with appended cluster assignment columns (kmeans_opt, pam_opt_aligned, etc.)

interpolated

SpatRaster of interpolated cluster values

clusters

SpatRaster of discrete clusters after interpolation
